channel.title: Best Price for Windows 7
channel.description: Where could I find Windows 7 Home premium 64 bit full version for the cheapest? So far the best I've found is ebay but I don't want to have to deal with Paypal.

item.title: Best Price for Windows 7
item.dc:creator: The_Assassin47
item.description:
Dillxn:

Free?
But seriously, I don’t know what to tell you, mate. Try NewEgg I suppose, but that’s all else I know to do.

No pirating please.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Price for Windows 7
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
krobar:

There is a website i don’t remember exactly its something to do with Australia and edu. It will give you a .edu mail account so you can pretend your a student and get the $30 student price. I’ve done it twice.

Links or BS.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Price for Windows 7
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
sersoft:

They don’t check ip locations these days? :fffuuu:

What would an ip location show? I used my student email to get a copy of Win7 and I did it all from home.

item.description:

garthbartin:

I know you’d probably be wary to trust anyone online and it wouldn’t be legal but if you could get me a student discount copy I’d pay you double.

There is a website i don’t remember exactly its something to do with Australia and edu. It will give you a .edu mail account so you can pretend your a student and get the $30 student price. I’ve done it twice.

item.title: Best Price for Windows 7
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
HomemadeMuffins:

Some students may be reselling for pretty cheap.

I can pick up a copy for 30 bucks (64-bit Home Premium) straight from Microsoft at the student discount.

Your best bet is probably, and unfortunately, eBay. Unless you’re a university student.

I know you’d probably be wary to trust anyone online and it wouldn’t be legal but if you could get me a student discount copy I’d pay you double.

Read full topic
